javelin.model.unit.abilities.spell.conjuration

Class Summon

  • java.lang.Object
    • javelin.controller.upgrade.Upgrade
      • javelin.model.unit.abilities.spell.Spell
        • javelin.model.unit.abilities.spell.conjuration.Summon
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable

    public class Summon
extends Spell
    Brings an ally to fight with your team. Upper Krust's method is not followed here since it makes no sense for a Gelugon (CR21) that could summon another Gelugon to be CR21.4. More discussion on #ratechallenge(int, String, float). TODO This should not be a Spell. See cast(Combatant, Combatant, boolean, BattleState, ChanceNode)
    Author:
    alex
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • ratechallenge

        public static float ratechallenge(java.lang.String monster,
                                  float chance)
        Rationale behind CR calculation: Monster counts as its own CR but divided by 5. 5 is the number of fights a Squad is supposed to be able to survive before resting according to the Dungeon Master's Guide. So a summonable counts as an ally of his CR that will participate in only 1 battle. Chance is applied as a normal %. TODO isn't taking into account summoning a group.

      • gemonstertcr

        public static int gemonstertcr(int targetcr,

      • cast

        public java.lang.String cast(Combatant caster2,
                             Combatant target,
                             boolean saved,
                             BattleState s,
                             ChanceNode cn)
        Description copied from class: Spell
        Once the spell hits, apply effect.
        Overrides:
        cast in class Spell
        saved - true in case the target's saving throw was successful.
        s - Should modify this directly (no internal cloning).
        cn - Can be used to set ChanceNode.overlay. Might be null, for example, if this spell is being triggered by an Attack effect.
        Returns:
        Description of outcome (do not assign to ChanceNode.action directly).
